statement: A snake_case message ledger should store normalized message fields plus core params (temperature, top_p, seed, max_tokens), while critic outputs remain in rubrics/scores with message references.
rationale: User prefers only meaningful fields in messages; domain tables still need critic outputs tied to message records.
keyAssumptions: Normalized fields are sufficient for analysis and debugging.
validationCriteria: Schema plan defines llm_messages with normalized fields and retains critic outputs in domain tables.
critiquePoints: Lack of raw payloads can hinder provider-debugging in edge cases.
questions: Which provider params are essential for analysis beyond temperature/top_p?
Do we need a minimal raw payload field for rare debugging?
